resources.string: Unless you're carrying a message from our scouting party, I'm afraid I've got not time for pleasantries, newcomer.
This is too much trouble for one man to handle. The town needs leadership! It's so hard to find good help these days…
I need to find my way out of this mess. This place has always been nothing but trouble.
What sad fate is this? Penniless and dispossessed on the long march south.
You were called here for a reason stranger. Your fate has not yet revealed itself to me, but that much is certain.
This is not what I signed up for… lurching from one crisis to another, while the towns leadership falls all to pieces.
If there's ever a time to buckle down, it's when there's lives hanging in the balance!
Stay a while, friend. Even in the hard times, we must take care of ourselves.
Don't get too hungry, angry, lonely, or tired… or you might make a mistake.
Pardon, but I was listening to Miss Leilani. Her stories are marvelous.
If you don't mind, I was just relating the tale of my arrival on this island to my friend here. Now, where was I, Pierre? 'Ae! I remember, stars…
That's not it… No, er… No, that's not it either…
Stay back! Unless… No, you don't look Corrupted. Still, best to keep your distance.
Don't draw attention to yourself! These hills are crawling with the Corrupted.
Welcome to the Weeping Pillow. This is the best place to stay when enjoying the Azoth-infused streams here in Mourningdale.
Ssh! I can almost hear it…
If you know what's good for ya, you'll pack it in.
Flippin' 'eck. Aren't you a sight for these paggered eyes! What do you need?
Flippin' 'eck. Aren't you a sight for these paggered eyes! What do you need?[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
You think you're so clever. Well you ain't seen nowt what I have.
Oh spare me your guff. If you'd seen the horrors of war I have, you'd quit the preaching and shut ya pie hole.
Oh wait, I almost have this solved. Golly, you are a nuisance, aren't you? Oh, hello.
At last! Someone with the acumen to comprehend my genius. Oh, did you need something, Sweetie?
At last! Someone with the acumen to comprehend my genius. Oh, did you need something, Sweetie?[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
I would comment on your lack of… a certain something between the ears, but that's wouldn't be proper, now would it?
I am so close to unveiling the secret to Azoth. Oh, what was it again? You cultists always appear at the wrong time… which is any time, really.
Mourningdale can be a dour place, but there is opportunity here for the inquisitive.
Like you, {playerName}. Your work with Krockes is quite famous, and now you are ready to advance in rank once again?
Mourningdale can be a dour place, but there is opportunity here for the inquisitive. [ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
Like you, {playerName}. Your work with Krockes is quite famous, and now you are ready to advance in rank once again? [ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
I predict these Psychokinetic Trace Absorbers will be literally full of traces soon.Imagine what we can learn!
I predict these Psychokinetic Trace Absorbers will be literally full of traces soon. Imagine what we can learn! [ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
Imagine what we can learn! [ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
When you are prepared to embrace the truth, the Covenant will be here.
Welcome, friend. I am here to serve our followers here in Mourningdale. Light the way.
Welcome, friend. I am here to serve our followers here in Mourningdale. Light the way.[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
I believe you must be lost, yes? I am here to share the light, but you are cast in shadow.
With your nose buried in books all the time, your eyes have become accustomed to the darkness. I hope you someday emerge into the light!

string.comment: In Mourningdale Tavern on the wall
string.name: JanJaansen

resources.string: A public letter posted by Jan Jaansen.

string.comment: In Mourningdale Tavern on the wall
string.name: JanJaansen

resources.string: A public letter posted by Jan Jaansen.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Acquire {itemName}
Craft {itemName}
When it Rains, it Pours
The Mourningdale settlement has been struck by tragedy and is in disarray. Constable Bayles will fill you in.
Greeting, stranger. I hope you're not here seeking comfortable shelter from the rains. Grayvale can offer few comforts these days.
"What's been happening?"
Disaster on top of disaster. The northern settlements have fallen, and a steady flow of refugees has us spread increasingly thin.
And to cap things off, my two most important advisors both say they're too busy attending to other matters to help.
"What matters are those?"
Magistrate Wallace says she’s still waiting on a scouting report, but her chief scout - Antonio Guerra - and she have an entanglement. She’s too close to this.
As for Gildon… well… this may sound a bit off, but she’s the town seer. Her second sight has saved us many times past. Unfortunately, she’s… not herself.
“I can talk to them.”
Anything you could do to return them to duty would be appreciated. The town’s in peril, and preparations will require their undivided attention.
I’d speak with Survivalist Fletcher first. She’s close with both of them and might have better advice for you. Now, regrettably, I have a town to defend.
If you want to help us, speak to Fletcher. She'll know all the latest developments.
The Constable sent you? I’m not sure what we can do. Magistrate Wallace is being completely irrational, won't do a thing until she gets news about Antonio.
As for Gildon… well… it’s probably best if you just talk to her. It’s not something one can really put into words.
"I'll talk to both of them."
It's worth a try, I guess. Gildon and the Magistrate are the only reason Grayvale has survived this long. We need both of them in top form.
Talk to Fletcher
Death and Duty
Defeat the former Watcher Antonio Guerra, find any scouting reports at his camp, and put his soul to rest. Then report back to Magistrate Wallace in the Mourningdale Settlement.
Damn it, Antonio! Where are you? Oh, sorry! I didn’t see you there. Apologies, but… I am quite busy planning the defense of the settlement. If you’ll excuse me…
Damn it, Antonio! Where are you?
Oh, sorry! I didn’t see you there. Apologies, but… I am quite busy planning the defense of the settlement. If you’ll excuse me…
"The Constable sent me to help."
Is that so? Well you certainly look capable enough, and I’m in no position to turn away an able body.
One of my best scouts, Antonio Guerra, took a party north to observe the movements of the Corrupted force gathering there. They haven’t reported back.
"I can track them down."
I would appreciate that. Start at the watchtower, and see if you can retrace their steps. I fear the worst, and Antonio is… dear to me.
Time is of the essence, friend. The Corrupted are gathering strength, and who knows what other forces array against us. Hurry!
So… this is it then? Antonio… lost to us. You’re sure? I suppose once this is all over, I will have eternity to mourn his loss.
Still, knowing is better. And there is some solace in knowing he gave his last life protecting us from harm. It’s how he would have wanted it.
"Any idea who's responsible?"
Not the Corrupted, it seems. From these reports, it appears that our troubles continue to multiply. The Lost are also arrayed against us.
I will need time to study his field reports before I am certain what to do next.
Search for signs of Antonio Guerra and retrieve his scouting reports
Put Antonio Guerra to rest
Search the camp for Guerra's Scouting Telescope and field reports
Tears in Rain
Defeat Spirits at Stephen's Claim to Collect Teardrop Gems. Then report back to Artificer Wrightson in the Mourningdale Settlement.
You must have made a wrong turn somewhere, stranger. There’s nothing but misery here. I’m heading south soon as I can. Grayvale be damned.
"What's keeping you?"
Money. What else? I’m aware of how foolish it sounds, but I once had a lot invested in this place, and I can’t just leave empty-handed.
You look capable… maybe we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I know a lot about this place, and I think I have a plan to make some coin.
"I'm listening."

string.comment: Male referring to group of deceased Males (Stephen and his party)
string.speaker: Artificer Wrightson
string.name: ArtificerWrightson

resources.string: Splendid. I may not look like much, but I’m a master jeweler. Believe it or not, the sort of trinkets I fashion travel better than cash.

string.comment: Male referring to group of deceased Males (Stephen and his party)
string.speaker: Artificer Wrightson
string.name: ArtificerWrightson

resources.string: You can always hawk one to keep the rain off your head on a long march. I know where we can get some stones of truly haunting beauty. There’s only one problem…
"Had a feeling that was coming."
Indeed! The stones are held by the Lost. The wraiths atop the mountain have them... beautiful, clear as teardrops! Get them and we'll share the reward.
Scared of ghosts, stranger? Can’t say I blame you. But there’s no reward without risk!
Well, aren’t you a marvel. I’ve been trying to get my hands on these gems since I first set foot in Mourningdale. They should fetch us a king's bounty.
Collect Teardrop Gems from spirits at Stephen's Claim
Defeat Wraiths at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} to Collect a Teardrop Gem
Defeat {targetName} to Collect a Teardrop Gem
Defeat {targetName} to Collect a Teardrop Gem
Silver Tongue, Golden Coins
Recover the gold medallions from Padre Nuñez at his Mansion. Then report back to Artificer Wrightson in the Mourningdale Settlement.
Of course… every jewel needs a fitting presentation. If you want to make some real money, there's one more thing we need…
"What would that be?"
You're clearly not afraid of a few Lost. And, in this case, you’ll be doing the world a favor. Who doesn’t love an altruist?
Our gems need a proper setting. I need gold bullion if these stones are going to fetch the price they're worth.
"Where can I find bullion?"
Not long ago, some silver-tongued Padre named Nunez got his town involved in some twisted cult. Convinced them to turn over all their treasures to the church.
Had them melted down into these gaudy medallions for his most zealous followers. The whole town’s fallen Lost, now. I doubt they’re going to miss them.
Just one more errand and we’ll have all the money we need to make ourselves scarce.
I think you’re my new best friend! Not only did you deliver the goods, but you punished that old snake Nunez.
Afraid I wasn’t entirely up front with you. That town you ransacked; it was my town. And that bastard Nunez led everyone I love to ruin.
“So this was about revenge?”
Partly. I do need the gold to set these gemstones, but it was also vengeance. Mind you, this was gold that belonged to the town, myself included.
Now, there’s your cut. A pleasure doing business with you. If I were you, I’d get gone before the Corrupted arrive.
Heh, heh, heh, it was a pleasure doing business with you, friend. Me? I'll be heading south… just as soon as I can find a buyer…
Recover gold medallions from Padre Nuñez at the {POITags}
Defeat Padre Nuñez
Recover the Padre's key
Retrieve medallions from the Padre's chest
Hearth and Home
Clear Weeper enemies from Porridgepot. Then report back to Constable Bayles in the Mourningdale Settlement.
I wonder if I could enlist your help for a personal matter. With everything going on here in Grayvale, I haven't been able to check in on my personal estate.
Would you be willing to pay a visit to Porridgepot, and make sure my property hasn’t come to any harm in my absence?
"I can do that."
You’re a true friend. A man’s home is his castle, but my first duty is to the citizens here. Keeping them safe is the priority.
I'm just trying to ensure I'll have something to go back to when this is all over.
Clear Weeper enemies from Porridgepot
Clear Weepers
Is something keeping you, friend? I’m eager to learn what’s become of my home in my absence.
You’re back? How fares my estate? Tell me it's not overrun with the Lost…
"I'd be lying if I did."
Ugh, the entire estate? This is terrible, terrible news… I guess Grayvale is the only home I have left now. I'll have to make the best of it.
I used to wonder how someone could fall Lost. Now… some days I feel like I'm on the verge of despair myself.
Lost in the Flood
Investigate the ruins in the Flooded Plains, and return found artifacts to Gildon in Mourningdale.
Get back, Child of Ruin! I see fire in your eyes! Fire that would consume this place in violence and madness. Red waves crashing upon this land.
I-I am sorry, stranger. My thoughts are not my own… the visions overwhelm my senses. I must focus! And yet, they are beyond control…
"Is there anything I can do?"
Probably not. The visions do not lie. But are they omens of the future or mere echoes of the past? I cannot be certain…
Perhaps… sometimes a talisman from a vision can serve to focus my gift. The Ancients had the gift of second-sight. Their ruins may hold answers.
"I could search the ruins."
I see a stone that tore open the sky, leaving a scar upon the earth. A beacon, still burning across ages. An edifice cracked by time, but also marred by violence.
Bring me a token of each of these, and I may be able to learn what darkness haunts my sight.
I must find my center, stranger. Without a center, there is only chaos and imbalance. Help me!
What you carry has brought clarity across time and space, stranger. These are artifacts from a lost age, but also omens of coming strife.
I fear what I have seen is what has happened, and what may still happen if we do not prevent it.
"It's the future and the past?"
In the ages past, our forerunners battled a timeless enemy. They defeated them, but the stakes were existential.
Brothers and sisters fought and died at each other's hands. The ruins are the legacy of that great conflict.
Search for artifacts in the ruins of {POITags}
Locate and collect the {itemName}
Search for artifacts in the ruins of {POITags}
Locate and collect the {itemName}
Search for artifacts in the ruins of {POITags}
Locate and collect the {itemName}
What was past may be returning again, stranger. An old sin revisited upon a new generation.
If we cannot stem the Red Tide, we too shall be swept away. A mystery pondered by the next cohort of martyrs and castaways.
The Broken Road
Defeat Novaguard foot soldiers in the lookouts along the Ancient Road, and give their armor scraps to Gildon in Mourningdale.
"How can we stop it?"
I must see more. The Guardians are the ones who once did battle with our insolent foe. They employed protections we might yet recover.
Bring me scraps from the armor of a few who shed blood in the conflict, and perhaps I can see a path forward to our survival.
"Where can I find them?"
Look along the mountain road. Though their armor lies in tatters, I can see its shine in my minds eye.
My vision remains hazy, stranger. Bring me what I need, or I fear history may repeat itself…
Yes. Yes! I can see it now, blood and flame and the roiling red wrath of the Corruption, scourging its way across the land!
These Guardians, some of the first granted immortality, giving their lives over and over again to stem the tide.
"The Guardians fought the Corrupted?"
I believe so… in the service of the Ancients themselves. But others defected to the side of evil. It was a war of annihilation.
Collect cloth scraps from Novaguard foot soldiers at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and Collect {itemName}
Collect armor scraps from Novaguard foot soldiers at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and Collect {itemName}
Look Back in Anger
Defeat Fineseer foot soldiers while climbing to the top of Vela, and show its treasure to Gildon in Mourningdale.
Within the visions, I saw a glimpse of something. A Watchman atop an Ancient Tower, ready to sound the alarm of the inevitable march.
Yes… I sense that his watch never ended. Perhaps, like his brothers and sisters in arms he is still waiting. Waiting for the inevitable return of his foe.
"I’ll find the Watchman."
A Watchtower, ancient and powerful, is your next destination. Vela. Your quarry stands proud and tall upon its peak.
Bring me the Watchman's spyglass. With such a talisman, perhaps I can see what he has seen, and in so doing, divine whatever future awaits us.
The Watchers in the Tower… against what did they stand guard? Is it the same now as it was then?
Yes! Can you feel it, stranger? This is the moment. When I gaze through this glass, I look back across the ages to the time of… Ah!
I see only darkness… a sky torn asunder. Strange alien landscapes despoiled by bile. The anguish of souls dispossessed…
"Focus! What do you see?"
The depths are fathomless… blackness so deep it buries the spark of your spirit within its gloom. And at its center: rage! Endless burning rage!
It is… the enemy! They are close. I believe that I glimpsed for a moment what will happen if we do not act quickly. The town must be prepared.
Claim the relic hidden atop Vela
Defeat {targetName} skeletons
Defeat {targetName} for his {itemName}
Misfortunes Multiply
Defeat Musslebeard and the Seasong pirates in his charge. Then report back to Magistrate Wallace in Mourningdale.
I’ve been going over Antonio’s journal. It appears that we face not one threat, but two. Like many places in Aeternum, our shores are plagued by Lost pirates.
They are a scourge even in good times. But at times like this… they are a potential catastrophe.
"Have they caused trouble lately?"
Yes, of course. Our scouts. Antonio's notes say the pirates found themselves a new leader. A brute they call Musslebeard.
His actions suggest this Musslebeard retains some sense of purpose and deploys his pirates accordingly. Their goal likely is Grayvale.
"We should strike first."
Agreed. We won’t survive an attack from both the Lost and the Corrupted. But all my resources are dedicated to fortifying the town. That just leaves you.
If you can slip into the pirate camp and kill Musslebeard, that should hopefully leave the pirates disorganized enough to eliminate them as a threat.
Hurry, friend. Musslebeard must be defeated. We can’t afford any distractions.
It’s done then? Musslebeard is destroyed and my Antonio avenged? Good. There is some solace in that.
He may be gone, but fate, it appears, has delivered you to ensure his life’s work continues. You have my thanks.
"Mourningdale needs you."
I see that now. I was a fool to lose focus. Antonio would be ashamed of me.
I will harden my heart. I will not let Grayvale fall to her enemies, Lost or Corrupted. Not while life still stirs in my soul!
Defeat Musslebeard and the Seasong pirates of {POITags}
Defeat members of Musslebeard's {targetName} crew
Defeat Musslebeard
Corruption's Call
Defeat the Redeyes and destroy Spewspitter's emblem in New Balefire, then return to Gildon in Mourningdale.
I think I have glimpsed something the enemy did not intend…
There is a place not far from here… a place where the Corruption draws the unwary into their grasp, whispering false promises and seductions.
"Do you know where?"
An Ancient Lighthouse by the sea, calling like a siren. I believe the place is called “Bahia”. There is a totem there, screaming at its heart.
Silence its call. Before any more of our people are deceived.
The scream still echoes through the souls of our neighbors, stranger. Make haste. No more may fall into the Corruption’s grip.
The fog has lifted from my eyes. The blur of past, present - all run together - no longer haunts my waking hours. There is clarity, but also still questions.
You have struck a blow against a powerful enemy this day. I only pray that it is enough. Return to Constable Bayles and tell him I am recovered.
"You're sure you're alright?"
In time, I will recover. But time is a luxury we do not have. I must be strong. For all our sakes.
Should my gift give me foreknowledge of the Corruption’s plans, the Constable will be the first to know.
You have my thanks. Not many would go to such lengths to aid a stranger.
May your courage and perservence stand as an example for us all.
Destroy Spewspitter's emblem in {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName} Corrupted
Destroy Spewspitter's Corrupted Emblem
Best Laid Plans
Investigate key locations to the north that have been taken by the Wardogs. Then report back to Magistrate Wallace in Mourningdale.
I'm afraid that Musslebeard is not the last of our problems here in Mourningdale.
"What's next?"
One faction of Corrupted known as the Wardogs, they gather their forces up north. Make no mistake. They formulate strategy to march on us here in Grayvale.
"Let's take the fight there."
Yes, that cannot hurt, but more importantly, we need to know their plan of attack. Search for any documents that might expose their strategy.
Fortune favors the prepared, friend. If we’re going to stop the Corrupted, we need to know precisely what they’re planning.
Aha! Ore from the mines and maps plotting the Corrupted’s movements. It seems like they’ve stopped to equip themselves for a long fight.
And now we know where they’re going to be, and how to counter their movements. If we can delay their southward march long enough, we may have a fighting chance.
"There's always hope."
It helps to hear you say that. I need to deliver my report to the Constable. You’ve proven yourself a hero to this town, friend.
If we survive this, know that you’ll always have a place here among us in Grayvale.
If I can muster even an ounce of the valor you've shown us stranger, I may be able to protect this settlement. And Antonio's legacy. You have my gratitude.
Loot {itemName} from chests in {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName}s at the {POITags}
Loot {itemName}es from chests in {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName}s at {POITags}
Investigate locations that have been taken by the Wardogs
Travel to {POITags} and disrupt the plans of the Wardogs
Search for Lerato's Heirloom Helmet in crates
Recover Lerato's Heirloom Breastplate from Corrupted
Retrieve Lerato's Family Sword from Corrupted
Find Captain McKeys' Shanty Book
Retrieve Captain McKeys' Hurdy-Gurdy from ghosts in Smuggler's Cave
Travel to the first site in Pierre's Guidebook
Travel to the second site in Pierre's Guidebook
Travel to the third site in Pierre's Guidebook
Travel to the last site in Pierre's Guidebook
Ode to Aeternum
Pierre Auguste would like new tales of Aeternum, but is too timid to travel himself. Write a collection of odes to the scenic locations described in Pierre's guidebook.
My heart swells at the breadth of Aeternum. But my mind has other things to say. Things about the Corrupted and the Lost!
"This place is scary and beautiful."
That's what I'm told. I even bought a guidebook! I admit though, I'm a coward. Quelle folie... It must be frightful to die.
"It was definitely memorable."
Just so. Pity I'll never know the places this guidebook describes. I feel so robbed. Unless…
"Unless?"
Well, you seem an adventurous type. Are you any sort of artist as well?
If you would go to each of these places and capture what you find in a poem or a song, I'd be thrilled!
Have you visited the places in my guidebook?
Ah, you're back! I'm burning with anticipation to read your contributions! Leilani's stories are wonderful, but she's retired. I yearn for new tales!
"I've written some pieces for you."
So you have! C'est bon! Now if you'll excuse me, it's time to drink in the sweetness of your poetry!

string.comment: At the bar - before he leaves
string.speaker: Pierre Auguste
string.name: PierreAuguste

resources.string: My feet itch, mon ami. Comme c'est triste! The tales that you and Leilani tell make me yearn for the road!
Think up an ode inspired by the view
Dream up a poem about the Ancients' aesthetic
Concoct a tale of your valiant victories
Consider a song about the journey
Investigate the location for Ancient artifacts
Investigate the location for Ancient artifacts
Defeat the Bladedancer to recover an Ancient artifact
Investigate the location for Ancient artifacts
Travel to the first site marked on Leilani's map
Travel to the second site marked on Leilani's map
Travel to the third site marked on Leilani's map
Travel to the first site Leilani marked on your map
Travel to the second site Leilani marked on your map
Travel to the third site Leilani marked on your map
Stone Cold Secrets
Follow Leilani's clues, written on your map, to complete her last adventure and find three lost artifacts of Ancient construction.
You've got the look of an adventurer about you. I was one of those once.
"Once? What happened?"
I finally encountered a cliff I could not climb. Old age. I can't fight like I used to and my bones ache more each day. My adventuring days are pau.
"Pau?"
Done, finished. But as I was saying, you've got the look of an adventurer about you.
If you'd like, I'll give you my notes. See if you can resolve my last adventure.
Are you taking a rest? In-between tasks? Do let me know if you've found whatever secrets are locked inside those monuments.
Well, look at this, Pierre! Our adventurer returns!
That's a confident swagger if I've ever seen one. Tell me what you've discovered!
Oh, to think I had put that little adventure to rest. What an exciting tale I would have missed had you not taken it up! Ah, a toast!
I can't believe Pierre would just run off like that. If I were younger, I'd already have gone after him. I hope he fares well.
Look for Pierre at the Soul Shrine to the far north
Defeat Sunadire Ancients defending the site
Search Three Sites for Ancient Artifacts
Look for Pierre at {POITags}
Find evidence of Pierre's passing through
Find evidence of Pierre's passing through
Find evidence of Pierre's passing through
Look for Pierre at {POITags}
Look for Pierre at {POITags}
Place the Artifact in the Impression
Place the Artifact in the Impression
Place the Artifact in the Impression
Defeat the Ancient Guardian
Bring Leilani's order to the Barkeep
Search for Corruption Emitters at the first checkpoint
Search for Corruption Emitters at the second checkpoint
Search for Corruption Emitters at the final checkpoint
Destroy Malign Nodes
Destroy Malign Nodes
Destroy Malign Nodes
Harvest a Thick Steak
Harvest a Tender Cheek
Harvest a Prime Loin
Butcher Mourning Pigs
Observe the Ancient Lighthouse from the end of the Pier
Return to Leilani with your stories
The Last Mystery
Travel to three locations marked on your map and investigate whether Leilani's key can be used at each.
Do you want to see something fascinating? Those artifacts you recovered have a very interesting quality.
"What's that?"
They fit together into a larger artifact. It's got markings that I believe correspond to some Ancient sites I visited in my adventuring days.
"Do you think it might be a key?"
Aye, you may be right! Would you test that theory? Even if we are wrong it will make for a great story!
Have you tested that artifact yet? I'm sure it all means something. What mysteries still lie hidden out there?
Look, Pierre! Our stalwart returns! Tell us, was it a key? What mysteries did it unlock?
"It activated the guardians!"
Oh my! I certainly couldn't have predicted that. But look how you've come through even so. Tell us all about it.
Amateur Adventurer
Follow the trail of clues to find where Pierre has gone.
A note written in Pierre's florid cursive.
A note written in Pierre's florid cursive.
Read the note
My friends! Your stories of valor and verve have inspired me! Soon I will be back to regale you with tales of my own adventure to the north!
This is the note left by Pierre when he set out for adventure.
Oh thank the heavens, it's you! I've been stuck here for days! C’est la galère!
Defeat the Wardog Corrupted
Song of the Sea
Find the Captain's lost Shanty Book and Hurdy-Gurdy.
Avast! No need to shove off so quickly!
I may look a fright, but I be not so addled as me crew. An' I'd be greatly obliged if ye'd help me with a wee ickle thing.
"If this is about money..."
Nothing like that. This be a tragic tale. Music’s me soul, y'see. But me crewmates never fancied me shanties.
Blamed 'em, in fact, for us having run aground on this rock. So they stole me hurdy-gurdy an' threw me out!
"That is tragic!"
For them, aye! The scurvy lot ended up Lost while I'm still here. Me music's what saved me. We go together like salt an' the sea.
But without me hurdy-gurdy an' me songbook, I can't quite recall me tunes…
I don't feel like meself these days. Me music be the only thing left to cling to out here.
Dancing dolphins! Me hurdy-gurdy! Ye've found her! An' me shanties as well! I don't know how I could repay ye.
[This scruffy sailor looks fondly out to sea, absorbed in a softly sung refrain.]
Village Champion
Recover Lerato's Heirloom armor and sword from the Corrupted in Ceremony and return them to her at the crossroads.
Where did they all come from? One day, peace, the next? Doom!
"The Corrupted?"
Who else? My father was our town's defender. He died fighting, and the Corrupted took his weapon and his armor.
I can't move on until I get them back.
"To honor your father's memory?"
No! To train up and return to liberate Ceremony!
It's my birthright, as daughter of the village champion. But I couldn't manage it on my own at the moment.
My father fought them in the streets, but for every one he struck down, five more would take their place.
You're back! And with my father's armor as well! I'd recognize it anywhere! You've done me and my father a great kindness.
Thank you for what you've done. For now, I will pack up my meager belongings and go to find my place in town.
Then, when I've regained my strength, I will reclaim my home!
Travel to the town of Ceremony
Malign Dominion

Find and destroy Malign Nodes at each of three Corrupt checkpoints along the road, then return to Harunobu at the crossroads. Some of these nodes are out of reach, you may need to bring a ranged weapon.
Can you believe how fast these Corrupted have advanced? It's uncanny. Forget sudden raids in the nighttime; this was directed!
"Are they preparing for an invasion?"
They must be! I may be just a hog farmer from Hibbotsfeld, but I recognize purpose when I see it!
They've locked down the northern road like a Corrupted constabulary!
"What's their insidious plan?"
I'm not sure, but they're planting those Malign Nodes everywhere.
I'd wager destroying those nodes would set them back a few pegs. Then again, I'm just a hog farmer.
Ah! Stay back! Oh, it's you again. Have you seen what those Corrupted are up to on the roads?
Yah! You have got to stop startling me like that! Did you see what those Corrupted are doing? Did you destroy their Malign Nodes?
"Those things grew right back."
Blast it! What will I do now? I'm just a hog farmer! My life's work is in Hibbotsfeld!
Makin' Bacon
Harvest Mourning Pigs in Hibbotsfeld for Harunobu and return them to him at the crossroads.
Oh the tragedy... Well, I reckon if I'm leaving for the duration, I'm going to want to take my life's work with me.
"Your life's work?"
Hogs! I'm a hog farmer. Always have been. I've got nothing left now! If only I had a way to get some of my precious pork…
"I could slaughter a hog or two."
You could go up to my farm and harvest some of the last of my hogs. Those are nice and plump!
At least then I'd have something to barter with when I show up at the settlement.
Well? Did you go to my farm? I'd do it myself, but I'm just a hog farmer.
Oh, that's Hibbotsfeld pork if I've ever seen it. Look at that marbling!
It's all in my special regimen of two quarts of beer and a massage for each pig, every day!
Thanks for all you've done for me. Time for this simple hog man to move to the city.
Just as soon as I gather up the courage to hit the road. Maybe Lerato and I can travel together?
Travel to Hibbotsfeld
Soul Music
Clear away the Withered around the Ancient Head so that Jan Jaansen can better hear the mysterious voice.
I can almost, just maybe, hear that head over there. Speaking to me. Can you hear it?
"I don't hear anything."
Are you sure? It's right there, playing at the edge of my hearing.
But those damned Withered are so loud. I can't hear myself think! If only they were gone.
"I could get rid of a few of them."
That would be wonderful! I'm Jan Jaansen, bard of some note you know! Maybe I'll write a ballad about your heroics!
I almost had it for a moment! If only those Withered were driven away… It's something like a poem…
Oh, I heard it! For but a moment it was clear as the dawn! A song of epic proportions, a song of…
Well, I'm not exactly sure yet, but gracious, am I inspired to figure it out!
I'm going to need some time to process this… This song, it's got a message…
New Perspective
Get to the end of Presage Pier and look for inspiration for the next stanza of Jan's epic.
We find ourselves in strange circumstances indeed, do we not?
Oh! It's you again! Would you be interested in more heroics? I could certainly use more heroics.
"I've been known to be heroic."
Worthy of ballads, I'm sure! Care to take on another task for me? The muse compels…
"What does the muse ask?"
Something about stone and sea. At first I was confused, but then I remembered!
Presage Pier is stone, in the sea! Then there was something about a lighthouse…
It all started with that voice, the one in the Ancient Head. Are you sure you couldn't hear it?
You are indeed a heroic sort, aren't you? Tell me then, what did you find?
Harmonic Resonance
Follow Jan Jaansen's inspiration to the location foretold in Jan's inspiration.
It all makes sense when you look at it from a particular perspective, doesn't it? It's in the tones, the vibrations! Can you hear it now?
"I still don't hear anything."
But it's in the air, it's all around us! I can hear it ringing. It's telling me that the secret is at The Lighthouse.
"That place is a nightmare!"
Mhnn mhnn! The muse is never wrong. I'm convinced that you'll find the song for yourself if you follow my intuition.
(Jan seems lost in her thoughts. She hums a haunting tune.)
(The Ancient Sculpture instills a compulsion to reach towards its surface. As if the merest touch would reveal a cosmic sense of music. A wordless vision of vastness, and of escape.)
(Beyond the stark silence, it almost sounds like there is a strange chant whispering in the wind…)
(This sculpted head has a strange aura. Stranger than usual.)
Follow the route revealed by Jan Jaansen's muse
Continue along the route revealed by Jan Jaansen's muse
Go to the final location revealed by Jan Jaansen's muse
Find Jan Jaansen along the north coast roads
A Toast to Adventure
Bring Leilani's Special Order to the Bartender in the Mourningdale Tavern.
"A toast?"
Ae! A toast to adventure. Faced with adversity, you still rise to the occasion. Reminds me of myself, when I was young and wild.
"Alright a toast then!"
I wrote my order down for the bartender. Do me a favor and bring it to him. I'm sure they'll waste no time in bringing up our order!
Hurry up and bring my order to the bartender, then! Don't hang about!
What's this? Another order from that woman upstairs? I thought I just saw her friend leaving…
Bring Leilani's Special Order to the Bartender.
Welcome to Mourningdale
Find Harunobu, recently of Hibbotsfeld.
"The Corruption problem is bad!"
So I've heard. More and more people falling through here lost their livelihoods. Some lost worse!
What with the Corruption up north, refugees are filtering in every day!
Shame they lost their homes, but at least they made it here safely. Best we can do is help 'em start again.
"Worse?"
No use in dwelling on it. Instead, why not go greet a couple of them, welcome them to their new home?
Have you checked in with those newcomers yet? Don't want them feeling left out after all that's happened to them.
Hey, it's {PlayerName}! Great to see you again. Want to try some of this pork? The facilities here are top-notch!
Welcome Harunobu to Mourningdale
Just a moment, I've got to keep a close eye on this roast…
We refugees need to stick together. If it hadn't been for the tenacity of our friend Lerato, I'm not sure I would have made it here.
Can you believe this? No one here has ever tried Hibbotsfeld barbacoa before! I'm richer than I've ever been!
The People in the Neighborhood
Bring a sample of Harunobu's roast pork to Lerato.
"I'm glad for you!"
I was at the brink of despair for a time there. But, that woman from the crossroads, Lerato? She was kind enough to travel here with me.
"That was kind of her."
Now, I'm doing much better. I may not be a hog farmer anymore, but I am a great hog roaster!
Do you mind bringing some of this to good old Lerato? She's here in town.
Hey {PlayerName}! Get that meat to Lerato while it's still hot!
Oh hello, what have you brought me? Ah, bless that Harunobu, he is so kind to me.
Do I know you? The past few days have been a blur.
Each day here I grow in strength and training. I've found there is an order that fights the Corruption. I may join with them. Such a grim lot, though.
Welcome Lerato to Mourningdale with a sample of Harunobu's roast pork.
Head to the town of Ceremony
Following the Bard's Song
Search the coastal roads for Jan Jaansen
Read the note.
Thanks for the inspiration! Here's to the brave soul that helped me to find my way on the roads north of the Settlement!
You're a real muse. I may write a song just about your great deeds! There are still heroes in this world! Let's cross paths again, perhaps in the north? -J. Jaansen
(Jan Jaansen wrote this note.)
It's as though you heard me calling for you from so far away.
Stay a while, friend. Even in the hard times, we must take care of ourselves.
Don't get too hungry, angry, lonely, or tired… or you might make a mistake.
Seasoned Adventurer
Race Pierre home to the Mourningdale Settlement
Mon Dieu, of course I would be captured! It is exactly what I feared. Oh, the Corrupted have taken me. It is not fair.
Thank the powers! I'd almost lost all hope!
"You should get home."
I intend to! I'll just take a moment to catch my breath, then I'll make haste back to my nice warm stool. Let's make a race of it! Bet I get back before you!
I've just tightened up my laces and checked my pockets. I'll be ready for the road soon. What will Leilani think of us when we get back and share our tale?
Well, well! You made it back! I thought you might have been faster than me, but here we are! Those bluish shrines really make travel convenient, non?
Imagine never having seen those places! Imagine never feeling so alive! And it's all thanks to you, mon ami.
I just need a moment to gather my strength. Then it's straight back to my table at the tavern. Now I've a story for Leilani, eh?
Pierre told me about what you did. Marvelous! If only there were more like you in this world.
Race Pierre Home to Mourningdale Settlement.
Locate and put an end to Baalphazu's Rising in Brightwood, Weaver's Fen, Mourningdale, or Ebonscale Reach collecting Baalphazu's Ichor from the fallen sentinel
Use Baalphazu's Ichor on a Nightveil Cauldron in any decorated settlement to fuel its protective wards
Can you sense that Nightveil Hallow is upon us? Cold mists creep from the hills. Darkness shrouds the forests in gloom. And above, the baleful moon watches all.
Something wicked has come…
Surely, you’ve heard the bloodcurdling shriek in the dark! Salvatore certainly has.
A monster stalks Aeternum, feeding like a ravenous jackal on the fear it creates!
Baalphazu's Fall

A monk named Salvatore Calabria has asked for your help in banishing a nightmarish demon that’s been unleashed on the citizens of Aeternum. Locate a Baalphazu Rising locationand banish the Marquis of Terror and his horde of Pumpkinites back to their shadowy realm.
“Aeternum has a few monsters.”
Not like Baalphazu, the Marquis of Terror!
This blasphemous creature has unleashed a dreadful curse. It must be stopped before it turns the island into a living nightmare.
“What kind of curse?”
The Maledicta Figurarum, the Curse of Shapes!
This foul sorcery transforms ordinary pumpkins into creatures known as Pumpkinites. They are Baalphazu’s hellish minions!
“How do I stop this demon?”
Shh, the secret lies in the demon’s ichor itself.
Baalphazu’s physical form must be destroyed and its putrid essence collected and hurled into the Nightveil Cauldron. Go forth and face this horror!
“What is Nightveil Hallow?”
It is a mysterious season of change, when shades and ghouls gather in dark places.
A time when the people adorn their houses with Jack-o-Lanterns and wear frightful masks.
“Why do they do that?”
To ward off Pumpkinites, of course! Seeing the gutted remains of their host bodies prominently displayed must surely send a strong message.
“Does it work?”
If someone hollowed out your head and planted it on their doorstep, would it not discourage your friends from venturing further?
“Tell me of this Pumpkinite curse.”
An insidious magic that transforms harmless pumpkins into ravenous creatures hungry for mischief and flesh.
They start as impish Pumpklins that caper about like goblins.
“What do they turn into?”
Terrifying fiends that spew acid or shape their limbs into vicious blades.
Luckily, the Pumpklins themselves can be used as weapons against their master.
“Do tell.”
You see, Baalphazu is particularly susceptible to the potent magic that animates the Pumpklins.
After you’ve defeated one, throw its head at the demon. Give Baalphazu an unexpected taste of home!
“Who exactly is Baalphazu?”
A demon of the Netherworld, known as the Marquis of Terror.
Baalphazu didn’t find its way here by accident. It was sent for the purpose of spreading fear far and wide.
“The Netherworld?”
Realms exist outside our own, some fair and some foul. Aeternum is a gateway to such places.
The Netherworld is a dark, twisted hell ruled over by nightmarish abominations.
“Who sent Baalphazu here?”
It’s best not to invoke the names of such powers, for they are always listening.
Suffice it to say that if Baalphazu’s master has taken an interest in Aeternum, we are all in great peril.
“What’s the Nightveil Cauldron?”
A potent magical vessel capable of dispersing the demon’s essence. Collect enough of the demon’s ichor and its grip on this world shall be broken.
And of course, the cauldron will reward you for your efforts.
Conquer Baalphazu in battle and bring its ichor to me for a reward. Only you can end this demon’s nightmarish rampage!
You’ve begun to disperse the demon’s foul essence! I knew you were the champion we needed.
But your battle has only just begun, for the demon’s grip on this world is strong.
“How many times must I do this?”
Until Baalphazu is banished back to the abyss from whence it came! Ah, if only the Hexen Sisters were here, especially my beloved Grimhild…
Ahem, go forth and continue the fight, noble sentinel!
“The Hexen Sisters?”
Three legendary witches who’ve settled in the wilds of Aeternum. They were the ones who crafted the Nightveil Cauldron.
The fairest of the three is the beautiful Grimhild, my frigid blossom of the north…
“Why aren’t they here?”
They are dealing with an errant member of their kind, a cannibalistic hag of fearsome reputation.
But they’re aware of Baalphazu’s presence and fear it portends darker things to come…
You are doing well, Sentinel of the Night!
Continue your efforts to banish Baalphazu back to the Netherworld by putting Ichor in the Cauldron. Aeternum will not be safe until you do!
I'm Master Fisher Abebe of Mourningdale. I can train you in the ways of fishing.
I'm Master Fisher Abebe of Mourningdale. I can train you in the ways of fishing.
Greetings, friend. May your casts be far and your hook be true.
(A bucket of Pumpkinite Innards sits next to the Nightveil Hallow Cauldron.)
(Salvatore mentioned something about keeping this bucket full to fuel the Cauldron. Should you put in Pumpkinite Innards?)
Bad? More like non-existent! I don't craft things so they can rot on the shelf!Art is only useful when it's being used, when it's being purchased!
"You can sell these?"
Not right away, but I can incorporate them in jewelry and other trinkets that will sell when this all blows over.
Here, I think this is fair reward for your work in acquisition.
"How old are you?"
So old, I cannot remember... or even think clearly. I just need a quiet place to retire.
There's a cottage in Porridgepot with a beautiful waterfall. If you could clear out the Weepers, it might be perfect for me.
"What treasure?"
An object from a darkened sky, akin to night, stars above, and a blinding light…
Go to the top of Vela, and bring me any relic of the Fineseers you find there.
"What is it then?"
My sight is limited by a pervasive influence, attempting to seal our fate in Mourningdale.
It's a Totem at the Bahia, a nexus of evil. It is your destiny to destroy it, {playerName}. Go and do so, with haste.
